adjective.description: (in the Christian Church) denoting formal permission from a bishop (letters dimissory) for a person from one diocese to be ordained in another, or (formerly) for an ordained person to leave one diocese for another.

origin: Late Middle English (as a plural noun): from late Latin dimissorius, from dimiss- sent away, from the verb dimittere. The adjective dates from the late 16th century, the original sense being valedictory.
